results.title: Hors d'oeuvre = Hors-d'oeuvre
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lipsett, Derek Lamb, Gerald Potterton, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Robert Verrall, Colin Low, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A collection of short cartoons produced by NFB animators. One-minute clips for government sponsors provide an amusing, fast-paced sampling of animation techniques. Among them are reminders about television programs, traffic safety rules, and the Department of Labour’s admonition, “Why wait for spring? Do it now.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Lipsett, Derek Lamb, Gerald Potterton, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Robert Verrall, Colin Low, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Horizons of hope
results.creator_credit: George Gordon, True Boardman, John Sutherland and John Sutherland Productions
results.brief_description: Animated and live-action sequences are used in describing the research program at the Sloan-Kettering Institute for Cancer Research where scientists are investigating methods to cure disseminated cancer.

results.title: Hoppity pop
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film in which coloured shapes dance in time to old-fashioned calling music. The film was made without a camera, by drawing directly upon the film with ordinary pen and ink. Simple, swift moving forms dance about the screen, carrying out the mood of the music as the humorous aspect of the old time circus calliope - missing stops and a tendency to go out of tune - are all included on the soundtrack. No commentary.

results.title: Hope is not a method
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to convey and illustrate the various methods of birth control. Seven types of contraception, in addition to vasectomy and tubal ligation are illustrated by means of animation and live action.

results.title: Hope for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film documents what was, for its time, a revolutionary breakthrough in occupational therapy - the pursuit of simple industrial vocation in sheltered workshops. A range of Victorian sheltered workshops are surveyed, and the filmmakers are keen to promote the greater satisfaction afforded their subjects by work which is both financially rewarding and socially useful.

results.title: Hong Kong today
results.brief_description: Hong Kong was faced after the war with problems of over-crowding, unemployment, hardship and disease which to a less courageous and hard-working people might have proved insurmountable. The film surveys the industrial and commercial expansion, the building schemes, the education and health services, the modernisation of transport and the outstanding achievements in land reclamation, which are bringing prosperity to the people of Hong Kong.
